Data.event_text: 19 January  José Alberto García Vilano, the leader of the Gulf Cartel, is arrested in Monterrey.

links.text: -"La Kena: Notorious Mexican cartel leader captured". January 19, 2024. Retrieved January 19, 2024.-

Data.event_text: A bus collides with a truck on a highway in Elota, Sinaloa, killing 19 people and injuring 18 others.

links.text: -"At least 19 dead and 18 injured after bus collides with truck in northern Mexico". AP News. January 30, 2024. Retrieved January 31, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Four people are killed and 15 others are rescued after a boat capsizes while travelling between Cancún and Isla Mujeres, Quintana Roo.

links.text: -"Four Mexican tourists died after a boat capsized in the sea between Cancun and Isla Mujeres". AP News. January 30, 2024. Retrieved January 31, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 February  Four taxi and bus drivers are killed during coordinated shootings in Chilpancingo.

links.text: -"4 bus and taxi drivers shot to death in violent southern Mexico city". AP News. February 5, 2024. Retrieved February 7, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 February  Illegal loggers kill three forest rangers in the foothills of the Iztaccihuatl volcano in Puebla.

links.text: -"Suspected illegal loggers kill 3 forest rangers on patrol in a forest in central Mexico". Associated Press News. February 27, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 February  A tractor-trailer and a pick-up truck collide in San Luis Potosí, killing 10 people.

links.text: -"At least 10 people killed in road crash in north-central Mexico, officials say". Associated Press. February 25, 2024. Retrieved February 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 March  Four soldiers are killed by a improvised explosive device in a trap near Aguililla, Michoacán. The soldiers were inspecting a camp, likely used by cartel members, when they stepped on an anti-personnel mine set in the underbrush.

links.text: -"4 soldiers killed in 'trap' in central Mexico, president says". AP News. March 1, 2024. Retrieved March 2, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 March  Three officers of the Michoacán Civil Guard are killed in an attack on a highway between Pátzcuaro and Uruapan.

links.text: -"3 police officers killed in an attack on western Mexico highway". AP News. March 19, 2024. Retrieved March 19, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 March  At least four people are killed in wildfires across the State of Mexico.

links.text: -"Forest fires spread in Mexico, at least four dead". Reuters. March 27, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 April  After local police arrest former vice-president Jorge Glas at its embassy in Quito in violation of Article 22 of the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations, Mexico suspends diplomatic relations with Ecuador.

links.text: -"Mexico suspends diplomatic ties with Ecuador after police raid embassy". The Guardian. April 6, 2024. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved April 6, 2024.-
-"Mexico suspends diplomatic ties with Ecuador after police raid embassy". The Guardian. April 6, 2024. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved April 6, 2024.-

Data.event_text: A total solar eclipse occurs over the states of Sinaloa, Coahuila, Durango, Chihuahua, Colima, and Nayarit, the first total solar eclipse visible from Mexico since 1991.

links.text: -"Apr 8, 2024 Total Solar Eclipse in Mexico". timeanddate.com. February 7, 2024. Retrieved February 7, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The headquarters of the state government of Guerrero in Chilpancingo is set on fire by demonstrators protesting the Iguala mass kidnapping.

links.text: -"Protesters in southern Mexico set state government building afire and torch a dozen vehicles". Associated Press. April 9, 2024. Retrieved April 9, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 April  Five people are found dead inside a house in Oaxaca after consuming a poisoned substance during a Santeria ritual.

links.text: -"Police say 5 people died in Mexico from drinking a poison potion in a Santeria 'power' ritual". Associated Press. May 2, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 April  Eighteen people are killed and 32 others are injured after a bus crashes on a highway in Malinalco, Mexico State.

links.text: -"At least 18 dead, 32 injured in Mexico highway bus accident". Reuters. April 28, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 May  Rolling blackouts affect several cities in Mexico amidst an ongoing heatwave.

links.text: -Rodríguez Mega, Emiliano; Yoon, John (May 8, 2024). "Rolling Blackouts Hit Several Cities as Heat Wave Scorches Mexico". The New York Times. ISSN 0362-4331. Retrieved May 8, 2024.-
-Rodríguez Mega, Emiliano; Yoon, John (May 8, 2024). "Rolling Blackouts Hit Several Cities as Heat Wave Scorches Mexico". The New York Times. ISSN 0362-4331. Retrieved May 8, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 11 May  Eight people are killed in a mass shooting in Huitzilac, Morelos.

links.text: -"Mass shooting causes deaths in crime-ridden township on southern edge of Mexico City, officials say". Associated Press. May 13, 2024. Retrieved May 13, 2024.-
-"8 people killed in mass shooting "right in the center of town" near resort area in Mexico". CBS News. May 13, 2024. Retrieved May 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 May  Eleven people are killed in two mass shootings in and around Chicomuselo, Chiapas.

links.text: -"11 people die in shootings in small town in southern Mexico state of Chiapas, prosecutors say". Associated Press. May 15, 2024. Retrieved May 16, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 May  El Califa de León, located in Colonia San Rafael, Mexico City, becomes the first Mexican taco stand to receive a Michelin star.

links.text: -Stevenson, Mark (May 15, 2024). "The first Mexican taco stand to get a Michelin star is a tiny business where the heat makes the meat". Associated Press News. Retrieved May 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 May  A mass shooting at a campaign rally in La Concordia, Chiapas, kills six people, including mayoral candidate Lucero López Maza, and injures two others.

links.text: -"Mayoral candidate and five others killed in shooting at campaign rally in Mexico". The Guardian. May 17, 2024. Retrieved May 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 May  San Pedro Garza García stage collapse Nine people are killed and 121 others are injured in a stage collapse in San Pedro Garza Garcia, Nuevo León.

links.text: -"Stage collapse at a campaign rally in northern Mexico kills at least 9 people and injures 121". Associated Press. March 23, 2024. Retrieved May 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 May  Dozens of people are killed across Mexico in a deadly heatwave, with temperatures as high as 45 °C (113 °F) recorded.

links.text: -"Mexico: Heat wave kills several people, hotter days ahead – DW – 05/24/2024". dw.com. Retrieved May 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 May  South Africa's genocide case against Israel Mexico announces it will intervene in the genocide case on the side of South Africa.

links.text: -"Mexico seeks to join South Africa's genocide case against Israel at ICJ". Middle East Eye. Retrieved May 29, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Mexican general election Claudia Sheinbaum is elected as the first female president of Mexico. The ruling party Morena party wins a supermajority in the Chamber of Deputies but not in the Senate, falling short of the two-thirds majority needed to change the Constitution.

links.text: -"Mexico elects Claudia Sheinbaum as its first female president". AP News. June 2, 2024. Retrieved June 3, 2024.-
-"Mexico ruling party wins lower house super-majority but falls short in Senate". Reuters. June 9, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Mexican local elections

links.text: -"Front-runner Claudia Sheinbaum poised to become Mexico's 1st woman president". CBC. Retrieved June 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: US President Joe Biden institutes a broad asylum ban on migrants illegally crossing the MexicoUnited States border, with actions to deport or turn people back to Mexico, with exceptions for unaccompanied children, people with serious medical or safety threats, and victims of trafficking.

links.text: -"Biden imposes sweeping asylum ban at US-Mexico border". Reuters. June 5, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The World Health Organization confirms the first human fatality from the H5N2 avian influenza virus following the death of a 59-year old man in Mexico City in April.

links.text: -"Man who contracted H5N2 bird flu dies in Mexico, WHO says". Al Jazeera. June 6, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 June  RICH nightclub railing collapse A third-story railing outside of the RICH nightclub in San Luis Potosí collapses, causing several young concertgoers to a Kevin Moreno concert to fall over 12 meters (39.4 feet), killing two and injuring 15.

links.text: -Portillo, Ligia. "Video: Tres muertos y 15 heridos: caen al menos 12 metros cuando ingresaban a sala de conciertos". www.reduno.com.bo (in Spanish). Retrieved June 11, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 89 June  Around 4,200 people are displaced after armed gangs attack the town of Tila in Chiapas.

links.text: -"Over 4,000 residents flee a town in southern Mexico after armed gangs start shooting, burn homes". Associated Press. June 11, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 June  Nine people are injured in an explosion in Acapulco.

links.text: -"9 people injured after explosion in main square of Mexico's Pacific coast resort of Acapulco". Associated Press. June 11, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 June  The American Civil Liberties Union files a lawsuit in federal court against the Biden administration for US President Joe Biden's new presidential directive which limits migrants seeking asylum at the MexicoUnited States border.

links.text: -"ACLU sues Biden administration over new executive action on the southern border". NPR. June 12, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 17 June  Salvador Villalva Flores, the newly-elected mayor of Copala, Guerrero, is shot dead aboard a bus in San Pedro las Playas.

links.text: -"A recently elected mayor is shot and killed in southern Mexico". Associated Press. June 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 June  The United States Department of Agriculture announces a temporary pause to any new imports of mangoes and avocados from Michoacán after an incident that reportedly causes security concerns for its safety inspectors on the ground.

links.text: -"USDA pauses avocado, mango inspections in Mexican state due to security concerns". ABC News. Retrieved June 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Three people are reported dead in Nuevo León due to Tropical Storm Alberto.

links.text: -"Season's first named storm dumps heavy rains on Texas and Mexico killing 3". AP News. June 20, 2024. Retrieved June 20, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Two people are killed during protests against suspected water contamination by a pork processing plant in San Antonio Limón, Veracruz.

links.text: -"2 people killed when police clash with locals protesting pork processing plant in Mexico". AP News. June 21, 2024. Retrieved June 21, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 June  United States Secretary of the Treasury Janet Yellen announces sanctions against eight members of La Nueva Familia Michoacana Organization.

links.text: -"Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on new fentanyl sanctions". WBUR-FM. June 21, 2024. Retrieved June 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 July  The bodies of 19 people are found in the vicinity of an abandoned dump truck in La Concordia, Chiapas.

links.text: -"Authorities find 19 bodies piled in a dump truck in a cartel-dominated area of southern Mexico". Associated Press. July 2, 2024. Retrieved July 2, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 July  Hurricane Beryl makes landfall on the Yucatán Peninsula after killing twelve people in the Caribbean.

links.text: -"Beryl moves into the Gulf of Mexico after battering Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula, takes aim at Texas". AP News. July 5, 2024. Retrieved July 6, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 July  Minerva Pérez, the head of the fishing industry chamber of Baja California, is shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Ensenada.

links.text: -"Gunmen kill a Mexican fisheries leader who complained of drug cartel extortion and illegal fishing". AP News. July 10, 2024. Retrieved July 10, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 13 to 21 July  2024 FIBA Under-17 Women's Basketball World Cup

links.text: -"Mexico will host the U17 Women's Basketball World Cup in 2024". Archysport. November 30, 2022. Retrieved November 5, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 17 July  Six members of two families are shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Yuriria, Guanajuato.

links.text: -"Gunmen in Mexico kill 6 people, including a boy, as mass killings of families increase". AP News. July 18, 2024. Retrieved July 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 July  Six people are killed in an explosion at a tequila factory owned by Jose Cuervo in Tequila, Jalisco.

links.text: -"Death toll rises to 6 in explosion and fire at tequila factory in Mexico". AP News. July 25, 2024. Retrieved July 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 July  Guatemalan authorities announce the arrival of 600 refugees from Mexico fleeing drug-related violence in Chiapas.

links.text: -"Authorities say 600 Mexicans have crossed into Guatemala to escape drug cartel violence". Associated Press. July 25, 2024. Retrieved July 27, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 July  Sinaloa Cartel co-founder Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada is arrested along with Joaquin Guzman Lopez, the son of imprisoned cartel co-founder Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán, by US authorities in El Paso, Texas.

links.text: -"US: Two leaders of Mexico's Sinaloa cartel arrested in Texas". DW News. July 26, 2024. Retrieved July 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Four men, including a police officer, are found shot to death near Cancún, Quintana Roo.

links.text: -"Police find the bodies of 4 men, including a policeman, shot to death near resort outside Cancun". AP News. August 2, 2024. Retrieved August 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Mexican Army confirms the first deaths of its personnel in drone strikes launched by drug cartels in Michoacán.

links.text: -"Mexican army acknowledges some of its soldiers have been killed by cartel bomb-dropping drones". AP News. August 5, 2024. Retrieved August 5, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 August  Journalist Alejandro Martínez is shot dead in Celaya.

links.text: -"Mexican journalist who covered one of the country's most dangerous crime beats has been killed". AP News. August 5, 2024. Retrieved August 5, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 20 August 2024 Mexican judicial reform Workers in federal courts nationwide go on strike in protest over plans by President López Obrador to have judges elected to office and reduce merit qualifications for judicial employees.

links.text: -"Mexico federal court employees strike over judicial changes requiring that judges stand for election". AP News. August 21, 2024. Retrieved August 21, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 August  Eleven gunmen working for the Los Zetas cartel are convicted and sentenced to up to 50 years' imprisonment for the killing of 122 people in the 2011 San Fernando massacre.

links.text: -"Mexico convicts 11 cartel gunmen in killings of 122 bus passengers near US border over 2 years". AP News. August 22, 2024. Retrieved August 22, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 August  Mexico suspends all interactions with the Canadian and American embassies in Mexico City due to claimed interference with its independence and internal affairs after both ambassadors criticized planned reforms in the judiciary.

links.text: -Romero, Simon; Rodríguez Mega, Emiliano (August 27, 2024). "Mexico Pauses Relations With U.S. Embassy Amid Clash Over Judicial Overhaul". The New York Times. Retrieved August 27, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 August  Two senators elected from the defunct Party of the Democratic Revolution (PRD) defect to the ruling Morena party, leaving Morena and its allies one seat short of a supermajority in both chambers of Congress.

links.text: -"Mexico's ruling party edges closer to a majority in both houses of Congress after 2 senators defect". AP News. August 28, 2024. Retrieved August 29, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 August  Three people are killed and 17 are injured after a car crashes into a group of migrants in Oaxaca.

links.text: -"3 migrants killed and 17 injured when vehicle hits them on a highway in southern Mexico". AP News. August 29, 2024. Retrieved August 30, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 September  Protesters demonstrating against the 2024 Mexican judicial reform storm the Senate building.

links.text: -"Protesters storm Mexico's Senate after ruling party wins votes for court overhaul". AP News. September 11, 2024. Retrieved September 11, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 September  President López Obrador signs the 2024 Mexican judicial reform into law, making Mexico the only country to have its judges elected by popular vote.

links.text: -"Mexico president signs contested judicial reforms into law". France 24. September 16, 2024. Retrieved September 16, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 17 September  Six people are killed in a landslide caused by heavy rains in Naucalpan.

links.text: -"6 die in a landslide caused by heavy rains in Mexico". AP News. September 17, 2024. Retrieved September 17, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 20 September  Rubén Oseguera González, the son of Jalisco New Generation Cartel leader Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, is convicted by a US federal jury of various drug-related charges and the downing of a Mexican military helicopter in 2015.

links.text: -"Mexican cartel leader's son convict". AP News. September 21, 2024. Retrieved September 21, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 September  Infighting in the Sinaloa Cartel  At least 70 people are killed following weeks of clashes between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel in Sinaloa.

links.text: -"Dozens killed in Mexico as rivals fight for control of Sinaloa cartel". Al Jazeera. Retrieved September 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 September  Hurricane John makes landfall near Marquelia, Guerrero, as a Category 3 hurricane, killing at least three people.

links.text: -"Hurricane John strikes Mexico's southern Pacific coast with 'life-threatening' flood potential". AP News. September 23, 2024. Retrieved September 24, 2024.-
-"Hurricane John falls apart after causing deadly mudslides on Mexico's southern Pacific coast". AP News. September 25, 2024. Retrieved September 24, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 September  President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum officially bans King Felipe VI of Spain from attending her inauguration on 1 October, citing his failure to apologize for the Spanish conquest in the 1500s. In response, the Spanish government says that it would boycott the event altogether.

links.text: -"Mexico excludes Spanish king from president's swearing-in". France 24. September 26, 2024. Retrieved September 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Hurricane John makes a second landfall near Tizupan, Michoacán, this time as a tropical storm, killing a total of 17 people.

links.text: -"John as a tropical storm hits Mexico's Pacific coast a 2nd time". Associated Press. September 28, 2024. Retrieved September 28, 2024.-
-"Along Mexico's Pacific coast, flooding from Hurricane John left devastated towns and 17 dead". Associated Press. October 1, 2024. Retrieved October 1, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Twenty-four surveillance cameras used by drug cartels are discovered attached to public installations in San Luis Río Colorado, Sonora.

links.text: -"Mexican authorities uncover 24 drug cartel surveillance cameras in city on the border with Arizona". AP News. September 28, 2024. Retrieved September 28, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 September  Mexico wins the 2024 Homeless World Cup competition in Seoul, South Korea, after defeating Romania 5-2 in the women's final and England 6-5 in the men's final.

links.text: -"Mexico sweep top trophies as Homeless World Cup wraps up in Seoul". Korea JoongAng Daily. September 28, 2024. Retrieved October 2, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 30 September  The government orders a ban on the sale of junk food in schools by April 2025.

links.text: -"Mexican schools have 6 months to ban junk food sales or face heavy fines". AP News. October 22, 2024. Retrieved October 22, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Claudia Sheinbaum is sworn in as the 66th President of Mexico. She becomes the first president to be inaugurated on that date since a change in the electoral law in 2014 moved the date from 1 December.

links.text: -"Claudia Sheinbaum sworn in as Mexico's first female president". Al Jazeera. Retrieved October 2, 2024.-
-"Mexico election live results 2024: By the numbers". Al Jazeera. June 3, 2024. Retrieved June 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: A truck carrying migrants is fired upon by soldiers near Huixtla, Chiapas, killing six passengers and injuring ten others.

links.text: -"6 migrants shot dead near Guatemalan border when Mexican army troops open fire". Associated Press. October 3, 2024. Retrieved October 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Four people are killed and two others are injured in an attack by unidentified gunmen on a drug rehabilitation center in Salamanca, Guanajuato.

links.text: -"Gunmen burst into a Mexican drug rehab center and kill 4 men and wound 2 others". Associated Press. October 2, 2024. Retrieved October 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 October   President Sheinbaum issues an official apology for the killing of student protesters by soldiers in the Tlatelolco massacre in 1968.

links.text: -"Mexico's new president offers apology for 1968 student massacre". France 24. October 2, 2024. Retrieved October 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 October  Twelve people are killed in a series of attacks by suspected drug cartels in Salamanca, Guanajuato.

links.text: -"12 people have been killed in coordinated attacks in violent Mexican city". Associated Press. October 4, 2024. Retrieved October 5, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 6 October  Alejandro Arcos, the mayor of Chilpancingo, is assassinated less than a week after taking office.

links.text: -"In Mexico, the mayor of a state capital has been killed less than 1 week after he took office". Associated Press. October 7, 2024. Retrieved October 7, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 13 October  Five decapitated bodies are found along a road in Ojuelos, Jalisco.

links.text: -"Five beheaded bodies found next to road in Mexico's Jalisco". Al Jazeera. Retrieved October 15, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 October  A US federal court sentences Genaro García Luna, the former Secretary of Public Security under President Felipe Calderón, to 38 years' imprisonment for colluding with the Sinaloa Cartel in smuggling illegal drugs into the United States.

links.text: -"Mexico's ex-security chief sentenced to over 38 years in US prison". France 24. October 16, 2024. Retrieved October 17, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 17 October  Unidentified gunmen open fire on the offices of the newspaper El Debate in Culiacán.

links.text: -"Mexican newspaper offices hit by gunfire in Sinaloa state capital". Associated Press. October 22, 2024. Retrieved October 22, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 20 October  Marcelo Pérez Pérez, a Catholic priest and indigenous rights activist working in Chiapas, is shot dead after celebrating Sunday mass in San Cristóbal de las Casas.

links.text: -"Priest shot dead in southern Mexico after leaving Sunday service". Al Jazeera. Retrieved October 21, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 October  Nineteen suspected gang members are killed in a shootout with soldiers outside Culiacán that leads to the arrest of a local leader of the Sinaloa Cartel.

links.text: -"Shootout in Mexico's Sinaloa state kills 19, local cartel leader arrested". NBC News. October 23, 2024. Retrieved October 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Sixteen people, including two responding police officers, are killed in a shootout between rival drug cartels in Guerrero.

links.text: -"Shootout between warring cartels leaves 16 dead in southern Mexico". Reuters. Retrieved October 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Three police officers are injured in a car bombing in Acámbaro, Guanajuato.

links.text: -"Car bomb attacks signal escalation of cartel violence in Mexico". El Pais. October 25, 2024. Retrieved October 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 October  A bus overturns after colliding with a trailer that had been detached from a truck in Zacatecas, killing 24 people and injuring five others.

links.text: -"Bus in Mexico crashes after colliding with trailer that detached from truck killing 24". Associated Press. October 26, 2024. Retrieved October 27, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 October  At least 16 pedestrians are injured in a car ramming in the cathedral square of Guadalajara by a suspect driving a stolen pickup who is arrested.

links.text: -"A car rams into a crowd outside a cathedral in Mexico and injures 16". Associated Press. October 27, 2024. Retrieved October 27, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Eight of the 11 justices of the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation, including its president Norma Lucía Piña Hernández, submit their resignations from the court.

links.text: -"Majority of Mexican Supreme Court judges resign after judicial reforms". France 24. October 31, 2024. Retrieved October 31, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Twelve people are killed in an explosion and fire at a steel factory in Xaloztoc, Tlaxcala.

links.text: -"12 dead and 1 injured in explosion at steel plant in central Mexico". Associated Press. October 30, 2024. Retrieved October 31, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Mexican Tennis Federation cancels its Juniors 30 tournament in Irapuato, Guanajuato, after ten underage players and a coach are targeted by a virtual kidnapping scheme.

links.text: -"Tennis event canceled after players and coach are victims of a 'virtual' kidnapping in Mexico". Associated Press. October 31, 2024. Retrieved October 31, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 November  A constitutional amendment banning judicial reviews to any constitutional revision passed by two-thirds majorities in Congress and two-thirds of state legislatures comes into effect.

links.text: -"What to know about changes to Mexico's Constitution that prohibit court challenges to amendments". Associated Press. November 1, 2024. Retrieved November 1, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 November  Two Colombian migrants are shot dead by the National Guard near Tecate.

links.text: -"Mexico's National Guard kills 2 Colombians and wounds 4 on a migrant smuggling route near the US". Associated Press. November 4, 2024. Retrieved November 5, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 November  The Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation rejects a petition to limit the scope of constitutional amendments regarding the election of judges to cover only justices of the Supreme Court.

links.text: -"Mexico Supreme Court rejects last-ditch effort to limit judicial overhaul". Associated Press. November 6, 2024. Retrieved November 6, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 November  Eleven people are found dead inside a pickup truck in Chilpancingo, while four others are found dead in a car in Acapulco.

links.text: -"Police find 11 bodies dumped by a highway in southern Mexico and 4 more in the resort of Acapulco". Associated Press. November 7, 2024. Retrieved November 8, 2024.-

Data.event_text: A rear admiral in the Mexican Navy is shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Manzanillo, Colima.

links.text: -"Gunmen kill a navy rear admiral in Mexico, one of the highest-ranking officers slain in a decade". Associated Press. November 9, 2024. Retrieved November 9, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Ten people are killed while 13 others are injured in a shooting by unidentified gunmen at a bar in Querétaro.

links.text: -"Gunmen open fire in a bar in central Mexico killing 10 and injuring 13". Associated Press. November 10, 2024. Retrieved November 11, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 November  The Miss Universe 2024 pageant is held at the Mexico City Arena.

links.text: -"Victoria Kjær Theilvig of Denmark is crowned the 73rd Miss Universe". Associated Press. November 17, 2024. Retrieved November 17, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 November  The police chief of Texcaltitlan, Mexico State, dies from suicide amid an attempt to arrest him on corruption charges. The mayor and police chief of Amanalco and the police chief of Tejupilco are also arrested on similar charges.

links.text: -"A police chief in Mexico kills himself as troops try to arrest him in a corruption probe". Associated Press. November 23, 2024. Retrieved November 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 November  Six people are killed and five others are injured in a shooting at a bar in Villahermosa.

links.text: -"Gunmen in southeast Mexico open fire in a bar killing 6 and injuring 5 as violence spirals". Associated Press. November 25, 2024. Retrieved November 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 30 November  Eight people are killed and two others are injured in a shooting at a food stall in Apaseo el Grande, Guanajuato.

links.text: -"8 dead in a mass shooting in a cartel-plagued town in central Mexico". Associated Press. December 2, 2024. Retrieved December 2, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 December  An unsuccessful hijacking is made on a domestic Volaris passenger aircraft flying from León to Tijuana, forcing its diversion to Guadalajara, where a passenger is arrested on suspicion of plotting to divert the aircraft to the United States.

links.text: -"Passenger who tried to force Mexican plane to fly to US said he was under threat by criminals". Associated Press. December 10, 2024. Retrieved December 10, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 December  Benito Aguas Atlahua, a federal deputy from the Ecologist Green Party, is shot dead by unknown gunmen in Zongolica, Veracruz.

10 December  Authorities announce the deaths of 17 children who were confined in various healthcare facilities in Michoacán, Guanajuato and the State of Mexico from blood infection caused by drug-resistant Klebsiella oxytoca bacteria believed to have been present in contaminated IV feeding bags.

links.text: -"Death toll from contaminated infant IV feeding bags in Mexico rises to 17". Associated Press. December 11, 2024. Retrieved December 11, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 11 December  Edmundo Román Pinzón, a judge in a state appeals court in Guerrero, is shot dead by unknown gunmen in Acapulco.
15 December  Jesús Franco Lárraga, the mayor of Tancanhuitz de Santos, San Luis Potosí, is shot dead along with three others by unknown gunmen in a highway ambush.

links.text: -"Gunmen kill the mayor of a small Mexican town and 3 others in a highway attack". Associated Press. December 17, 2024. Retrieved December 17, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Four police officers are killed in an attack on a patrol near Uriangato, Guanajuato.

links.text: -"Four police officers killed in Mexico's most violent state". Associated Press. December 18, 2024. Retrieved December 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Two soldiers are killed in a landmine explosion in Michoacan blamed on the La Resistencia cartel.

links.text: -"Blast kills 2 Mexican soldiers and wounds 5 others in suspected booby trap by drug cartel". Associated Press. December 18, 2024. Retrieved December 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 December  Two soldiers are killed in a landmine explosion in Michoacan blamed on drug cartels.

links.text: -"2 more Mexican soldiers killed by an improvised landmine, after 2 died earlier this week". Associated Press. December 20, 2024. Retrieved December 20, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 19 December  Seven inmates are killed in a prison riot in Villahermosa.

links.text: -"7 inmates are dead after a prison riot in southern Mexico". Associated Press. December 20, 2024. Retrieved December 20, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 December  The skeletal remains of 12 people are recovered from a clandestine grave site in Ascensión, Chihuahua.

links.text: -"Mexican investigators find 12 bodies in clandestine graves in the northern border state of Chihuahua". Associated Press. December 27, 2024. Retrieved December 27, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 December  A bus and a truck collide near Xalapa, killing eight people and injuring 27 others.

links.text: -"8 people killed in a collision between a bus and a truck on Mexico's Gulf coast". Associated Press. December 28, 2024. Retrieved December 28, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 December  The bodies of 15 people are recovered from clandestine grave sites in La Concordia, Chiapas.

links.text: -"Mexican authorities find 11 clandestine graves with 15 bodies near border with Guatemala". Associated Press. December 30, 2024. Retrieved December 30, 2024.-
